biography.content:
Luisa Parraguez graduated with honors from the PhD in International Relations at the National Autonomous University of Mexico and holds a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Political Science from McGill University in Montreal, Canada. Her area of specialty is North American comparative politics, U.S. Foreign Policy and global agenda issues. Professor Parraguez was a Visiting Scholar at the MacMillan Center for International Studies at Yale University in 2014, at the Center for the Study of Globalization at Yale University in 2013, and a Visiting Professor of Political Science at Yale University in 2012. She is an alumni in Security Studies at the Center for Hemispheric Defense Studies (CHDS) of the National Defense University in Washington, D.C., and is a fellow of the “United States in the World” Salzburg Global Seminar in Austria which produced policy recommendations to the Obama Administration, and an alumni of the U.S.-Mexico Studies Program at the University of California, San Diego. 

Perfectly trilingual in Spanish, English and French, she taught in Tec de Monterrey/Universidad Central de Chile´s International Winter Program in 2014 & 2013. Professor Parraguez is currently a full-time Professor and Researcher in the School of Humanities and Social Sciences at Tecnológico de Monterrey, Mexico City Campus. She was previously the Director of the International Studies Department (2008-2009) and the Associate Dean of the School of Humanities and Social Sciences (2009-2010).

keyword.content: International Affairs, Globalization, US Foreign Policy, International Security
